question: You are a student at a University in the UK. You have recently lost your University ID card. Write to the local police station, giving details of who you arewhat happened and ask to record your details so that you can apply for a new ID card
text: Hope you are doing good, I am Abhishek Fulsunge a first-year student at a UK university studying in the science department. I am writing to log a complaint regarding my lost university card so that I can apply for a new card at the university

I lost my card in a very unfortunate event that happened on avenue street where I was robbed by a few miscreants around 10:00 pm . Since it was pitch dark, I was not able to see these miscreants and hence was caught off guard and was robbed .
However, I am grateful that I am safe and sound but to get the new badge I need to formally lodge an accusation  and provide a copy of the accusation letter to the educational institution.

Therefore, I request you to please consider this letter as the formal complaint about my lost badge and request you to record these details and provide me with  a received copy so that I can submit the letter to the educational institution.
Thank you for your support and looking forward to receiving the return copy from your department .
